title: Part c. [0–4]
stimulusHtml:
4 points

For all the following:

A practical procedure that uses some or all of the apparatus listed and would work

Recognition of any assumptions that must be made

Indication of the proper mathematical computation using the variables measured

Two points were awarded if the description of the procedure was not complete but it would work, or if the mathematical work did not clearly specify the variables used, or any combination of the above.

No points were awarded if the procedure would not be feasible in a laboratory situation with the apparatus listed, or if the procedure was merely a repeat of that outlined in part a.
